the binary contains packed code segments
use a disassembler to analyze the executable

examine the import table for external dependencies
the entry point begins execution of the program
static analysis reveals the code structure
dynamic analysis observes runtime behavior
breakpoints pause execution at specific addresses
the debugger allows stepping through instructions
registers hold temporary values during execution
the heap stores dynamically allocated memory
strings in the binary reveal program functionality
obfuscation techniques hide the true logic
unpacking reveals the original code

the return instruction pops the saved address

hooks intercept function calls at runtime
the PE header describes the executable format
sections contain code data and resources
relocation fixes addresses at load time
the linker resolves external symbol references
calling conventions define parameter passing
the stack grows downward in memory
buffer overflows corrupt adjacent memory
shellcode executes arbitrary instructions
the instruction pointer tracks execution
opcodes encode machine instructions
the assembler converts mnemonics to bytes
cross references show function relationships
virtual functions use indirect calls
the vtable holds method pointers
polymorphic code changes its appearance
anti debugging tricks detect analysis
timing checks measure execution speed
checksums verify code integrity
the packer compresses the executable
encryption hides sensitive strings
the loader maps the file into memory
trampolines redirect function calls
inline hooks patch the target code
the GOT stores global offset addresses
PLT entries resolve dynamic symbols
